eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed Consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Signed Informed Consent Form

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age Requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Age 18 years at time of signing Informed Consent Form

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Protocol Compliance
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Ability to comply with the study protocol

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraception Requirements
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: For women of childbearing potential: agreement to remain abstinent (refrain from heterosexual intercourse) or use contraception, and agreement to refrain from donating eggs, as defined below: Women must remain abstinent or use contraceptive methods with a failure rate of 1% per year during the treatment period and for 3 months after the final dose of study treatment. Women must refrain from donating eggs during this same period.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: China Enrollment Phase
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: For patients enrolled in the extended China enrollment phase at NMPA-recognized sites: current resident of mainland China, Hong Kong, or Taiwan, and of Chinese ancestry

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: BRVO Diagnosis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Foveal center–involved macular edema due to BRVO diagnosed no longer than 4 months prior to the screening visit and confirmed by central reading center (CRC) based on SD-OCT (or SS-OCT) images. BRVO is defined by retinal hemorrhages, telangiectatic capillary bed, dilated venous system or other biomicroscopic evidence of retinal vein occlusion (RVO; neovascularization, vitreous hemorrhages) in one quadrant or less of the retina drained by the affected vein

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: BCVA Range
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: BCVA of 73 to 19 letters, inclusive (20/40 to 20/400 approximate Snellen equivalent), as assessed on the ETDRS visual acuity chart at a starting test distance of 4 meters (see the BCVA manual for additional details) on Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: CST Measurement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: CST 325 m, as measured on Spectralis SD-OCT, or 315 m, as measured on Cirrus SD-OCT or Topcon SD-OCT at screening (SS-OCT acceptable after confirmation with CRC)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Ocular Media Clarity
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Sufficiently clear ocular media and adequate pupillary dilatation to allow acquisition of good quality retinal images to confirm diagnosis

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Major Illness or Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any major illness or major surgical procedure within 1 month before screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Active Cancer
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active cancer within the 12 months prior to Day 1 except for appropriately treated carcinoma in situ of the cervix, non-melanoma skin carcinoma, and prostate cancer with a Gleason score of 6 and a stable prostate-specific antigen for 12 months

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prohibited Therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Requirement for continuous use of any medications and treatments indicated in Section 4.4.2 (Prohibited Therapy)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Systemic Infection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Systemic treatment for suspected or active systemic infection on Day 1. Ongoing use of prophylactic antibiotic therapy may be acceptable if approved after discussion with the Medical Monitor.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Systemic Corticosteroid Use
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any systemic corticosteroid use (e.g., oral or injectable) within 1 month of the screening visit

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Uncontrolled Blood Pressure
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Uncontrolled blood pressure, defined as systolic blood pressure 180 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure 110 mmHg while a patient is at rest on Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Stroke or Myocardial Infarction
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Stroke (cerebral vascular accident) or myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other Disease or Condition
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of other disease, metabolic dysfunction, physical examination finding, or historical or current clinical laboratory findings giving reasonable suspicion of a condition that contraindicates the use of the investigational drug or that might affect interpretation of the results of the study or renders the patient at high risk for treatment complications in the opinion of the investigator

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy or Breastfeeding
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pregnant or breastfeeding, or intending to become pregnant during the study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Severe Allergic Reaction
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of a severe allergic reaction or anaphylactic reaction to a biologic agent or known hypersensitivity to any component of the faricimab or aflibercept injections, study- related procedure preparations (including fluorescein), dilating drops, or any of the anesthetic and antimicrobial preparations used during the study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Investigational Trial Participation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participation in an investigational trial that involves treatment with any drug or device (with the exception of vitamins and minerals) within 3 months prior to Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Previous RVO Episodes
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of previous episodes of macular edema due to RVO or persistent macular edema due to RVO diagnosed more than 4 months before screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: BCVA Increase
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Increase of 10 letters in BCVA ETDRS score between screening and Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Irreversible Vision Loss Cause
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any current ocular condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, is currently causing or could be expected to contribute to irreversible vision loss due to a cause other than macular edema due to RVO in the study eye (e.g., ischemic maculopathy, Irvine-Gass syndrome, foveal atrophy, foveal fibrosis, pigment abnormalities, dense subfoveal hard exudates, or other non-retinal conditions)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Vitreous Hemorrhage
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Current visually significant vitreous hemorrhage on Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Retinal Detachment or Macular Hole
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of retinal detachment or macular hole (Stage 3 or 4)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Macular Architecture Disruption
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Tractional retinal detachment, vitreomacular traction, full thickness macular hole or epiretinal membrane involving the fovea or disrupting the macular architecture in the study eye, as evaluated by the CRC and described in the CRC manual

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other Retinal Diagnosis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Diagnosis of diabetic retinopathy (DR) moderate non-proliferative or worse, proliferative DR, diabetic macular edema (DME), neovascular age-related macular degeneration (nAMD), geographic atrophy, myopic choroidal neovascularization as assessed by the investigator

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Neovascular Conditions
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active rubeosis, angle neovascularization, neovascular glaucoma

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Aphakia or Anterior Lens
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Aphakia or implantation of anterior chamber intraocular lens

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent Cataract Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any cataract surgery or treatment for complications of cataract surgery with steroids or YAG (yttrium-aluminum-garnet) laser capsulotomy within 3 months prior to Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other Intraocular Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any other intraocular surgery (e.g., pars plana vitrectomy, scleral buckle, glaucoma surgery, corneal transplant, or radiotherapy)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior RVO Treatment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any prior or current treatment for macular edema due to RVO, including antivascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) IVT for macular edema due to RVO

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Macular Laser
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Macular laser (focal/grid) in the study eye at any time prior to Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Panretinal Photocoagulation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Panretinal photocoagulation in the study eye within 3 months prior to Day 1 or anticipated within 3 months of study start on Day 1

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other IVT Treatment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any IVT treatment for any other retinal diseases that can lead to macular edema complication

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Macular Edema Treatment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any prior or current treatment for macular edema; macular neovascularization, including DME and nAMD; and vitreomacular-interface abnormalities, including, but not restricted to, IVT treatment with anti-VEGF, steroids, tissue plasminogen activator, ocriplasmin, C3F8, air or periocular injection

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Laser or Surgery Interventions
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any prior intervention with verteporfin photodynamic therapy, diode laser, transpupillary thermotherapy, or vitreo-retinal surgery including sheathotomy

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Steroid Implant
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any prior steroid implant use including dexamethasone intravitreal implant (Ozurdex) and fluocinolone acetonide intravitreal implant (Iluvien)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Periocular Treatment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Prior periocular pharmacological or IVT treatment (including anti-VEGF medication) for other retinal diseases

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Non-functioning Fellow Eye
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Non-functioning fellow eye, defined as either one of the following: BCVA 20/320 or worse; No physical presence of fellow eye (i.e., monocular)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Faricimab Use
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Prior IVT administration of faricimab in either eye

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: History of Uveitis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of idiopathic or autoimmune-associated uveitis in either eye

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Active Ocular Inflammation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active periocular, ocular or intraocular inflammation or infection (including suspected) in either eye on Day 1

population.name: Patients with macular edema due to BRVO
